Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "v-show/v-if seems not working after route changed " (#1771) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello, I encounter this weird issue during using vue-router. After I transition to different route(component) and then get back to the same component, the v-show/v-if is not working and all the DOM element will has the style 'display: none' on it no matter how I change the data like 'isDesignContentShow' below. ```
``` Any help is really appreciated : )

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "router.push & router.replace to return promise if callbacks are not provided" (#1769) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
It would help preventing callback hell... Would be more consistent with vue js api... 

### What does the proposed API look like?
router.push('/new/url').then(() => doSomeCoolStuff())

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Make $router and $route writable" (#1768) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
One of the most common issue for users testing Vue components is that they can't stub `$router` or `$route` in a test case. 

*see vue-test-utils intercept [option](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-test-utils/blob/dev/docs/en/api/options.md)*

This is usually caused by them requiring a file somewhere in their test suite that installs Vue Router.

Making `$router` and `$route` writable would stop users having this issue.

### What does the proposed API look like?
We could set $router and $route as writable properties.

We could add a setter that logs a warning when the props are rewritten.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
